alert.note: Alert for Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 4:41PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Union County in south central Arkansas and north central Union Parishes through 530 PM CST... At 441 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Strong, or 10 miles southwest of Huttig, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huttig, Lapile, Marion, Felsenthal, Cecil, Oakland and Litroe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for south central Arkansas.
